# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt, bump = 3)
    # Check if the input is a DateTime
    if isa(dt, DateTime)
        return dt + Hour(bump)
    elseif isa(dt, Date)
        throw(ArgumentError("Function supports only DateTime, got Date instead."))
    else
        throw(ArgumentError("Invalid type for timestamp, expected DateTime or Date, got $(typeof(dt)) instead."))
    end
end
```

This function takes a `DateTime` object `dt` and an optional integer `bump` (defaulting to 3) representing the number of hours to increment the timestamp by.

If the input is a `Date`, it throws an `ArgumentError`. For any other type, it also throws an error specifying the expected types.
